alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 06 at 4:43AM MST until March 06 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7PM SUNDAY FOR PORTIONS OF THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Windy conditions return today, especially along and south of Interstate 40. Though high temperatures will be cooler than Saturday, humidity values will still fall below 15 percent through mostly Socorro County in the Middle Rio Grande Valley and portions of the East Central Plains. Critical fire weather conditions are expected to develop during the afternoon hours in these areas. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the East Central Plains of New Mexico Sunday afternoon though early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Westerly at 25 to 35 mph with gusts as high as 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Dropping between 9 and 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley
